title: Red Dead Redemption 2 on PC out November confirms Rockstar
text:
Red Dead Redemption 2 – finally coming to PC

The long-awaited PC version of Red Dead Redemption 2 will be out next month, with Rockstar offering free games as a pre-order bonus.

More than a year after the game was originally released on Xbox One and PlayStation 4, Red Dead Redemption 2 has finally been announced for PC.

It’ll be out on 5 November, via the recently announced Rockstar Games Launcher – which will enable you to pre-purchase the game from next Wednesday, 9 October (and get a free copy of GTA V).

As well as GTA V though, pre-purchasing will also allow you to pick two free games out of the following list of six:

• Grand Theft Auto III

• Grand Theft Auto: Vice City

• Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

• Bully: Scholarship Edition

• L.A. Noire: The Complete Edition

• Max Payne 3: The Complete Edition

You’ll also be able to get the Special Edition or Ultimate Edition of the game for a discount and the Outlaw Survival Kit, War Horse, and Treasure Map for story mode.

So yeah, Rockstar are very keen that you pre-purchase.

There’s not much concrete detail on what will be different about the PC version, with the first screenshots not due until 9 October, but Rockstar are promising ‘a range of graphical and technical enhancements for increased immersion along with new Bounty Hunting Missions, Gang Hideouts, Weapons and more’.

It’s implied that Red Dead Online will be available straight from launch and will include all previously released updates for consoles, including Frontier Pursuits and the specialist Roles of Bounty Hunter, Trader, and Collector.

You don’t have to buy the game via Rockstar if you don’t want to, as it will also be available via the Epic Games store, Greenman Gaming, the Humble Store, GameStop and ‘additional digital retailers’ starting October 23rd. There’s no mention of Steam though.

Red Dead Redemption 2 will also be coming to Stadia when that launches later this week, but perhaps the big question now is whether there’ll be a remastered version – perhaps based on this new PC edition – for the upcoming PlayStation 5 and next gen Xbox.
